overview: A white bisexual vampire, Lillia, is trapped in a monotonous cycle with her thoughtless, misogynist vampire partner, Luke (who, while also being a bisexual, prefers to devour women prey). Her encounter with Black lesbian Zena, who is reading about goddesses across religions and cultures and thinking about the horror film genre, pulls Lillia out of a state of bad faith into an enlightened state of knowledge and play.  'The Mark of Lilith' was the graduation film of Bruna Fionda, Polly Gladwin, Zach Mack-Natafâ€™s from The London College of Printing, under the tutorship of Laura Mulvey.  The film was shot in Brixton and made with a cast and crew of local filmmakers, artists and activists.  The Mark of Lilith was digitally restored from the 16mm print by the BFI in 2021.
title: The Mark of Lilith
